alert.note: Alert for Brown; Clermont; Clinton; Highland (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 5:14PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN CLERMONT, NORTHWESTERN BROWN, SOUTH CENTRAL CLINTON AND SOUTHWESTERN HIGHLAND COUNTIES THROUGH 545 PM EDT... At 514 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located 7 miles north of Mount Orab, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Mount Orab, Lynchburg, Russell, New Market, Fayetteville, St. Martin, Chasetown, Danville in Highland County, Greenbush, Buford, State Route 32 at US Route 68, State Route 136 at US Route 62 and Lake Lorelei. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Residents in these areas should remain alert. If this storm becomes stronger, then a warning may be needed. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for southwestern Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
